On Sunday, Jul 27, 2003, at 10:59 Europe/Dublin, justin_t_sampson wrote:
> The user interface is implemented completely on the client side
> using HTML and JavaScript.

at first i wondered why not use conneg (perhaps based on the user agent 
(UA))
rather than a 'browser-within-a-browser' approach.  as in, the editor 
GETs
wiki-text, and everything else GETs HTML.

i would like to create a RESTful wiki one day as well, real life 
permitting.
FWIW i would model the resources as:

/topic/ : GET gets HTML.
/topic/form/ : GET gets a HTML form with a target of ".." and the 
wikitext
loaded in to a textarea.  the submit method would be POST, even though
semantically i think PUT would be more appropriate here.

i would also like a resource /topic/revisions/ which gives an
annotated-diff revision history of the topic, like viewcvs.

it's always nice to see another real-world RESTful application; kudos on
a nice piece of work.

-vincent
